name: Chicken And Mushroom Plait Pastry Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup mozzarella, grated (mix with tasty cheese)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven 200 degrees C. Heat a splash of oil in frypan, and brown the chicken in 2 or 3 batches, til golden in colour, it doesn't need to be cooked through. Place in a bowl to the side.
Fry off the garlic and mushrooms till the liquid from the mushrooms has evaporated.

Place the chicken back in with the mushrooms and sprinkle the flour over, then mix well. Gradually add the milk whilst stirring til the sauce thickens. Next add the mustard, salt and pepper and two thirds of the cheese.
Cook for another 5 minutes until chicken has cooked through. Leave to cool.
Place 2 sheets of pastry on a large tray and join them together by pressing gently.

With a knife, gently score the pastry into thirds, longways, do not cut all the way through. Make a point at the top by cutting off the two top corners. At the bottom, cut a square off from each side, it should now look like a Xmas tree. Now cut strips on an angle on the outer two thirds. This is where I forgot to take a photo.

(refer to photo) Starting a little way down from the point, place the cooled filling down the middle and scatter on a few spring onions and a sprinkle of cheese. Fold over the point. Next fold in the pastry strips, alternating sides and fold bottom over to finish. Egg wash the top and sprinkle remaining spring onions and cheese.
Bake for 25 minutes until nicely golden. Enjoy with veggies or a salad.
